title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: The Old Hall of Ashbourne, situated at the higher end of the town, was afine old mansion, with a long history, dating from the Cockayne family,who were in possession of lands here as early as the year 1372, and whowere followed by the Boothby family.
